name: Red Flags for Human Rights, Environment, Health or Safety

Does your organization have a policy statement regarding environmental and human rights that goes beyond a standard code of conduct (e.g. on topics such as the prohibition of child labor, forced labor or slavery, freedom of association, non-discrimination, non-harassment, wages and benefits, standard working hours & overtime, anti-human trafficking, accident/medical emergency at work, occupational health & safety standards, handling and disposal of waste, handling of persistent organic pollutants, handling of mercury, etc)?
Has your organization designated a responsible officer that is in charge of human and environmental rights within your company?

Does your human rights and environmental risk management system include a process to ensure the enforcement of due diligence obligations for indirect vendor, the implementation of preventive measures, a process for taking and documenting remedial actions, and the reporting of all these efforts?

To the best of your knowledge, are you aware of any red flags or human rights, environmental or health and safety related risks in your business or in your supply chain (including any indirect vendor whose supplies are necessary to manufacture the product or for the provision and use of the relevant service)?
Has your company established a dedicated risk management system to deal with human rights and environmental related risks?
